channel.title: Post to specific place//another question
channel.description:
[b]1.[/b] OK, so when a user visits viewforum.php?f=3 (ex, btw), and posts a topic there, how would I make it post it into forum 3? (You don't need to tell me every detail, just the code that would do it.. I can figure the rest out) would it be: [code]INSERT INTO topics (tname, tbody, tpb, tpi) VALUES ('$tname', '$tbody', '$tpb', '$_GET["f"])[/code] Where tpi is topic posted in.
And then to display it would be:?
[b]2.[/b] Ok, so say I have forums 1 - 5.. If someone tries going to ?f=6, how would I make it so that it would say something like "The forum you selected does not exist." ?

item.title: Post to specific place//another question
item.dc:creator: @abrhm2119 abrhm2119
item.description:
@abrhm2119 wrote:

true. with the code imjohn posted, anybody could easily fuck up your forums.

for example, if the value in ‘GET’ is something like ‘[id] OR 5=5’ it will display ALL rows in the current table. and, if instead of adding an ‘OR’ (for an always true statement like 5=5), you add an ‘AND’ (for a never true statement like 5=6), it will not display ANY threads.

item.title: Post to specific place//another question
item.dc:creator: @imjohn10 imjohn10
item.description:
@imjohn10 wrote:

@ question 1:

something like this:

[code]<?php

$id = (int) $_GET[‘id’];

$sql = “SELECT * FROM table WHERE id = ‘$id’”;
$query = mysql_query($sql);

while ($row = mysql_fetch_assoc($query)) {
echo $row[‘tname’] . ‘
’;
echo $row[‘tbody’] . ‘
’;
}

?>[/code]

@ question 2:

something like this:

[code]<?php

$id = (int) $_GET[‘id’];

$sql = “SELECT * FROM table WHERE id = ‘$id’”;
$query = mysql_query($sql);
$numRows = mysql_num_rows($query);

if ($numRows == 1) {
// some code
} else {
echo “The forum you selected does not exist.”;
}

?>[/code]
